meanings.definition: The scientific study of the human mind and behavior.
meanings.sent1: In psychology class, we learn about how people think and act.
meanings.sent2: She decided to major in psychology to understand human behavior better.
meanings.sent3: The psychology of cats is a mysterious subject that many try to unravel.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a complex puzzle, a realm of psychology waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The psychology of fear can be fascinating to explore in horror movies.

meanings.definition: The mental characteristics or attitude of a person or group.
meanings.sent1: Her psychology showed she was a caring and empathetic individual.
meanings.sent2: The psychology of the team changed after their big win.
meanings.sent3: The psychology of fashion trends can be quite intriguing to analyze.
meanings.sent4: The psychology of a crowd can sometimes lead to unexpected outcomes.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the psychology of a character can enhance the reading experience.

meanings.definition: The way a person thinks or behaves.
meanings.sent1: His psychology led him to always see the positive side of things.
meanings.sent2: The psychology behind her actions was complex and multifaceted.
meanings.sent3: The psychology of decision-making can sometimes be influenced by emotions.
meanings.sent4: The psychology of a champion involves determination and resilience.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the psychology of motivation can help improve productivity.
